text: My suicidal thoughts are back tw I went a good couple of weeks without any kind of suicidal thoughts  I was content with life  and I even stopped self harming for a bit  I was so content  I thought this was finally over  Now my suicidal thoughts are back full throttle and I don t know why  Every time I get bored or tired or even just a little sad about something my mind goes straight to  you should kill yourself It s relentless noise in my head It s so overwhelming sometimes I just lay on the floor in the dark listening to white noise because my brain is so busy   I can t describe this feeling  It s just like anything I do I get frustrated  and sad  I can t do the things I like doing   I m trying to keep myself busy  drawing  listening to music  shopping  cutting  seeing friends  But in the end it always leads back to  imagine how satisfying and beautiful it would be to be dead I wish I could tell someone  But I m sure everyone around me has heard enough of my ranting and raging  And the last thing I want to do is drive any more people away  What would I even say  I feel guilty for taking up the space I do  I feel guilty for taking up other people s time with my worries  What are they supposed to do anyways  Just say  be suicidal no more  Even my therapist has begun getting short with me  I guess for the lack of progress I m making  I don t think she understands how hard I m trying  How hard I m pushing to make this all work  to be better  I don t want to make it worse  I m trying  and I m still drowning   what if this is all my life will ever be  Just cycles of wanting to kill myself and being high on life I m so trapped  I m so lost  And frustrated and scared  I don t want to live a life like this  I don t want to die  I want the noise to stop  I want the pain to end   please  help me
summary: My suicidal thoughts are back. I went a good couple of weeks without any kind of suicidal thoughts. My therapist is getting short with me for the lack of progress I'm making. I don't want to live a life like this and I want the pain to end.
cleaned: suicidal thought go good couple week kind suicidal thought therapist get short lack progress make not want live life like want pain end

text: An endless cycleAlways starts with boundless energy  Will be able to function with average of   hours of sleep nightly for week long stretches  First couple of nights of sleeplessness will start with watching TV into the early morning  Next few nights will consist of some sort of organizational task or in depth research of different topics   i e making lists  doing math  cleaning  Google searches and reading multiple articles from different sources on the same subject etcetera  This devolves into the next set of nights consisting of me laying in bed trying to sleep but unable to because of racing thoughts  First the thoughts are mostly positive   how I can be more efficient at work  how I should be balancing work and home life etc  Then I start to panic about things  how I don t have time to do the things I want  how I m being a terrible parent  how I ll never love a man who d love me back etc  This spirals into an attack so prolonged and intense that I just wish to stop existing  At this point I ll think about everyone in my life and how I can t leave them and how horrible it would be for them if I was to just disappear  That then leads to me thinking that maybe they d be better off  These two thoughts cycle in my mind while I cry and rock back and forth  All my muscles are tensed at this point and I usually have my head down with my arms covering it so I can a  dig my nails into the back of my neck or b  pull at my hair  Can only get myself to stop by taking old insomnia meds that I won t refill because there are currently not enough in the bottle to kill me if I down the whole thing  But I m running out and I m afraid of when I do  The only way to make the thoughts stop is to sleep and I can t without something that can possibly kill me if I decide to overdose
summary: Always starts with boundless energy and can function with average of hours of sleep nightly for week long stretches. Next few nights consists of sleeplessness and racing thoughts. The only way to stop the thoughts is to sleep, but she's running out of the medication and she's afraid of overdosing.
